data.title: Authentically Vietnamese
data.text: Food is so good! Authentic vietnamese food. The restaurant did not look impressive but we were pleasantly surprised by how good the food was. The service was a little slow as there were only 2 waitresses but it is worth it! The egg roll were the best I have tried in Colorado as well as the Grilled pork noodle bowl(Bun Heo). The egg roll was crispy and just the right mix of ingredients. Bun Heo was perfect for a hot day, just the right coolness for the noodles, the grilled pork and vegetables. The pho soup was tasty just like those in Vietnam. They have combination rice plates which are for those who need a little heavier lunch. Definitely the place to go for authentic Vietnamese food.

data.title: My Favorite Restaurant
data.text: I've been going to the New Saigon for years. It is the best. We celebrated Mother's Day there and my whole family loves it too.

data.title: Solid, but not fantastic
data.text: Very reasonably priced, but nothing that blows my mind on food.  Nice enough staff, reasonably service, but nothing exceptional.

data.title: Good but nothing to write home about
data.text: We were staying close and felt like Asian food.  The restaurant was a small, mom and pop kinda place.  The staff was great.  The atmosphere was average.  The food was good, but nothing to brag about.  The menu wasn't extensive.  I probably would try another place if ever back in that area.  There seem to be several Asian places in the vacinity.

data.title: Favorite Vietnamese in the Denver area!
data.text: We fell in love with Vietnamese food while on vacation there a few years ago.  Since then we have tried every Pho place within a 40 mile radius.  Many have been good, but we have finally found the high bar here.  The Pho was the most authentic that we have found and the medium bowl was so big I really wondered how big the large could possibly be.  I had a combination noodle bowl and the meat on it (pork, shrimp, etc.) was so good I wanted to find out if I could just get a big plate of that one day!  Extremely friendly staff - low key, unassuming place that you can tell is all about the food.  Excellent prices too!

data.title: Amazing!!
data.text: We are pho addicts, and when passed this place earlier in the day we made sure to come back for dinner. We are traveling from out of state, so we had no idea what it would be like. The service was amazing....so friendly and so nice. The pho and rolls were probably the best we've ever had. We are picky pho eaters, and the dinner was such a pleasant surprise! The owner was so friendly and happy that we came in and really took the time to ask us about our dinner, etc. they recently opened, and I wish him the best of luck. This place is a winner!

data.title: Best Pho for north Denver
data.text: We visit Saigon Pho every other week for great pho. The broth is to die for. Fair amount of choices for Pho. I have a problem because I also love the rice noodle bowls. It's had to chose between the Pho, noodles and the other items. And if you dare try the iced coffee!

data.title: The place for Pho
data.text:
I'll admit, until recently I was a Pho virgin. But all that's in the past as I'm now a super-fan!!

At the recommendation of a co-worker, a few friends and I headed to Pho Saigon today and I had my first taste of wonderful, delicious pho.  Not much to say but YUM! I got the rare steak and brisket - the meat was perfectly tender and all the added basil, sprouts and jalapenos gave just the right kick. 

The rest of the menu looked great, but I was on a pho mission. The staff was super friendly and really fast - I will definitely be back the next time I need a pho fix.

data.title: Great food
data.text: Eat there once a week. Great food. Employees don't speak much English. Best pho place around. Like all the other menu items too!
